leaf_cluster.leaf_cluster_name: 神经科学-神经影像与连接组生态
leaf_cluster.task_chain: 预处理→配准→连接组→统计→评测
leaf_cluster.tool_form: pipelines + 图分析 + 可视化

tools.name: AlizaMS
tools.one_line_profile: DICOM viewer with 2D and 3D visualization capabilities
tools.detailed_description: AlizaMS is a DICOM viewer that supports 2D and 3D visualization of medical images. It provides tools for viewing DICOM files from various modalities and includes features for basic image manipulation and analysis.

tools.name: ecg-dicom-web-viewer
tools.one_line_profile: Web-based viewer for ECG data in DICOM format
tools.detailed_description: A TypeScript library that enables the rendering and viewing of Electrocardiogram (ECG) files in DICOM format directly within a web browser using HTML5 canvas.

tools.name: Homer3
tools.one_line_profile: MATLAB application for fNIRS data processing and visualization
tools.detailed_description: Homer3 is an open-source MATLAB application designed for the analysis and visualization of functional Near-Infrared Spectroscopy (fNIRS) data. It provides a GUI for processing streams and viewing results.

tools.name: BioExplorer
tools.one_line_profile: Interactive visualization tool for large-scale scientific data
tools.detailed_description: The Blue Brain BioExplorer is a tool designed for scientists to extract and analyze scientific data through visualization and interactive exploration, supporting large-scale biological simulations.

tools.name: OHIF-AI
tools.one_line_profile: OHIF DICOM viewer integrated with server-side AI segmentation models
tools.detailed_description: An extension of the OHIF DICOM Web viewer that integrates server-side AI models (such as SAM2, medSAM2) to enable advanced segmentation and annotation workflows directly within the viewer.

tools.name: NeuroCave
tools.one_line_profile: Immersive visual analytics tool for exploring the human connectome
tools.detailed_description: NeuroCave is a web-based visual analytics tool that facilitates the exploration of human connectome data in group studies, supporting immersive visualization for complex brain network analysis.

tools.name: DICOMweb-js
tools.one_line_profile: JavaScript client library for consuming DICOM Web Services
tools.detailed_description: A JavaScript client library designed to interface with DICOM Web Services (QIDO-RS, WADO-RS, STOW-RS), enabling web-based medical imaging applications to query and retrieve DICOM data.

tools.name: DMRITool
tools.one_line_profile: Toolbox for diffusion MRI reconstruction, processing, and visualization
tools.detailed_description: DMRITool is an open-source C++ toolbox focused on the reconstruction, processing, and visualization of diffusion MRI data, including DWI, tensor, ODF, EAP, and fiber tracking.

tools.name: Visbrain
tools.one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated suite for brain data visualization
tools.detailed_description: Visbrain is a Python-based, GPU-accelerated open-source suite designed for the visualization of various brain data modalities, including EEG, intracranial signals, and brain connectivity.

tools.name: Asclepios DICOM Viewer
tools.one_line_profile: Desktop DICOM viewer built with C++, Qt, and VTK
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive DICOM viewer application developed using C++, Qt, and VTK, supporting the visualization and inspection of medical imaging data.

tools.name: DICOMweb WSI Viewer
tools.one_line_profile: Whole slide imaging viewer for Google Cloud Healthcare DICOM API
tools.detailed_description: A proof-of-concept web viewer for Whole Slide Imaging (WSI) data, designed to interface with the Google Cloud Healthcare DICOM API for visualizing digital pathology slides.

tools.name: dicom-microscopy-viewer
tools.one_line_profile: Web-based library for viewing DICOM slide microscopy
tools.detailed_description: A JavaScript library for visualizing DICOM Whole Slide Imaging (WSI) data in web browsers, developed by the Imaging Data Commons.

tools.name: SLIM
tools.one_line_profile: Web-based DICOM slide microscopy viewer and annotation tool
tools.detailed_description: SLIM is an interoperable, web-based viewer for DICOM slide microscopy that includes tools for annotation, supporting digital pathology workflows.

tools.name: jsdicom
tools.one_line_profile: JavaScript DICOM library and viewer
tools.detailed_description: A JavaScript library and viewer for parsing and displaying DICOM files in web applications.

tools.name: simpleITK-Snap
tools.one_line_profile: Qt-based 3D data visualization tool wrapping SimpleITK
tools.detailed_description: A 3D data visualization tool built with Python and Qt, serving as a lightweight wrapper around SimpleITK for medical image viewing and analysis.

tools.name: VolView
tools.one_line_profile: Web-based 3D radiological viewer for DICOM data
tools.detailed_description: VolView is an open-source, web-based radiological viewer that supports DICOM loading, volume rendering, and annotations directly in the browser, emphasizing data privacy.

tools.name: Kitware ImageViewer
tools.one_line_profile: Lightweight cross-platform 2D/3D medical image viewer
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight, cross-platform application for viewing 2D and 3D medical images, developed by Kitware.

tools.name: ConnectomeViewer
tools.one_line_profile: Visualization and analysis tool for multi-modal neuroimaging data
tools.detailed_description: A Python application for the visualization and analysis of multi-modal, multi-scale network and neuroimaging data, facilitating connectomics research.

tools.name: ENIGMA Toolbox
tools.one_line_profile: Toolbox for accessing and visualizing ENIGMA neuroimaging datasets
tools.detailed_description: The ENIGMA Toolbox provides open-source tools for accessing ENIGMA statistical maps, visualizing cortical and subcortical surface data, and analyzing brain organization across micro- and macroscales.

tools.name: DicomVis
tools.one_line_profile: Simple 4-pane DICOM series viewer
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight Python application using VTK for visualizing series of DICOM images in a standard 4-pane layout.

tools.name: PhantomViewer
tools.one_line_profile: Analysis package for MRI phantoms
tools.detailed_description: A Python package developed for analyzing MRI phantoms, supporting quality control and standardization efforts by NIST and collaborators.

tools.name: NeuroMorph
tools.one_line_profile: Toolkit for neuronal morphology analysis and visualization
tools.detailed_description: NeuroMorph is a toolkit designed for the analysis and visualization of neuronal morphology, providing capabilities to manipulate and inspect neuron structures.

tools.name: OHIF Viewer
tools.one_line_profile: Extensible, web-based medical imaging platform
tools.detailed_description: The OHIF Viewer is a zero-footprint, web-based medical imaging platform that supports DICOM viewing, segmentation, and extension for various oncology and radiology workflows.

tools.name: 3D Slicer
tools.one_line_profile: Multi-platform software for medical image visualization and analysis
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive platform for medical image informatics, image processing, and three-dimensional visualization. It supports a wide range of imaging modalities and provides advanced tools for segmentation, registration, and quantification.

tools.name: SlicerDMRI
tools.one_line_profile: Diffusion MRI analysis and visualization extension for 3D Slicer
tools.detailed_description: An extension for 3D Slicer that provides tools for diffusion magnetic resonance imaging (dMRI) analysis, including tractography, diffusion tensor imaging (DTI), and visualization of fiber bundles.

tools.name: Connectome Workbench
tools.one_line_profile: Visualization and analysis tool for neuroimaging data
tools.detailed_description: A visualization and analysis tool developed by the Human Connectome Project (HCP). It specializes in handling surface and volume data, allowing for the exploration of brain connectivity and cortical structure.

tools.name: seeVieweR
tools.one_line_profile: MATLAB-based 3D viewer for NIfTI images
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight 3D viewer for NIfTI neuroimaging data built in MATLAB, designed for quick visualization and inspection of brain images.

tools.name: CVU
tools.one_line_profile: Connectome Visualization Utility
tools.detailed_description: A Python-based utility for visualizing connectome data, facilitating the exploration of brain network connectivity matrices and graphs.

tools.name: AFNI
tools.one_line_profile: Analysis of Functional NeuroImages
tools.detailed_description: A leading software suite for processing, analyzing, and visualizing functional MRI (fMRI) data. It provides a comprehensive set of tools for statistical analysis and image display.

tools.name: nbpapaya
tools.one_line_profile: Papaya.js viewer integration for Jupyter Notebooks
tools.detailed_description: A Python library that enables the embedding of the Papaya medical image viewer directly into Jupyter Notebooks, facilitating interactive visualization within data analysis workflows.

tools.name: brainSurfer
tools.one_line_profile: MATLAB toolbox for surface-based brain data visualization
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB toolbox designed to visualize neuroimaging data on brain surfaces, supporting various mapping and display options for cortical analysis.

tools.name: vscode-neuro-viewer
tools.one_line_profile: Neuroimaging viewer extension for VS Code
tools.detailed_description: A Visual Studio Code extension that allows researchers to visualize and inspect neuroimaging data (NIfTI, etc.) directly within the code editor environment.

tools.name: pydcmview
tools.one_line_profile: Terminal-based medical image viewer
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight, terminal-based viewer for DICOM, NRRD, and NIfTI images, enabling quick inspection of medical imaging data in command-line environments.

tools.name: vibrant-tractography
tools.one_line_profile: Web-based tractography visualization tool
tools.detailed_description: A high-performance web-based viewer for visualizing tractography data, built with Rust to handle large-scale fiber tracking datasets efficiently in the browser.

tools.name: Nextcloud DICOM Viewer
tools.one_line_profile: DICOM viewer integration for Nextcloud
tools.detailed_description: An application for Nextcloud that allows users to view and analyze DICOM medical images directly within the Nextcloud web interface, facilitating secure data sharing and review.

tools.name: dicompyler
tools.one_line_profile: Radiation therapy research platform and DICOM viewer
tools.detailed_description: An extensible open-source platform for radiation therapy research and a viewer for DICOM and DICOM RT data. It supports visualization of dose distributions and structures.

tools.name: Rocket Viewer
tools.one_line_profile: Generic viewer for medical images and biological data
tools.detailed_description: A versatile web-based viewer designed to visualize various types of biomedical data, including medical images, 3D surfaces, and electrophysiological signals.

tools.name: rs_signal_extract
tools.one_line_profile: BIDS App for resting-state fMRI signal extraction
tools.detailed_description: A BIDS App that uses Nilearn to extract resting-state fMRI signals from preprocessed data, adhering to the BIDS standard for reproducibility.

tools.name: BioImage Suite Web
tools.one_line_profile: Web-based medical image analysis suite
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive web-based medical image analysis suite that runs in the browser. It offers tools for visualization, registration, segmentation, and connectivity analysis.

tools.name: DyNeuSR
tools.one_line_profile: Dynamical Neuroimaging Spatiotemporal Representations
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for visualizing and analyzing spatiotemporal patterns in neuroimaging data, focusing on dynamical representations of brain activity.

tools.name: brainrender
tools.one_line_profile: Python package for 3D neuroanatomical visualization
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for creating high-quality 3D renderings of neuroanatomical data, registered to reference atlases (e.g., Allen Brain Atlas). It facilitates the visualization of brain structures and experimental data.

tools.name: brainsprite
tools.one_line_profile: Web-based 3D brain slice viewer
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight tool that turns a sprite of brain slices into an interactive 3D web viewer, allowing for easy embedding of brain visualizations in web pages.

tools.name: BRAPH 2.0
tools.one_line_profile: Brain Analysis using Graph Theory
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive software package for the analysis and visualization of brain connectivity data using graph theory. It supports various imaging modalities and provides tools for network construction and metric calculation.

tools.name: eegtools
tools.one_line_profile: Python modules for EEG analysis and visualization
tools.detailed_description: A collection of Python modules for EEG data analysis, including tools for loading data formats (EDF+, BDF), plotting scalp maps, and applying spatial filters.

tools.name: QIT
tools.one_line_profile: Quantitative Imaging Toolkit
tools.detailed_description: A software suite for the visualization, processing, and analysis of neuroimaging datasets, with a focus on diffusion MRI and structural connectivity.

tools.name: BIDS-fMRIpost
tools.one_line_profile: Post-processing workflow for fMRIPrep outputs including denoising and connectivity analysis
tools.detailed_description: A Python-based tool designed to perform basic fMRI data post-processing following fMRIPrep. It leverages nilearn to execute tasks such as confound regression, spatial smoothing, BOLD signal extraction, and functional connectivity network creation within a BIDS-compliant framework.

tools.name: headjack
tools.one_line_profile: Terminal-based interactive NIfTI viewer
tools.detailed_description: A command-line interface tool written in Rust for viewing NIfTI neuroimaging files directly in the terminal. It provides a lightweight, keyboard-driven interface for quick inspection of volumetric brain data without the need for a graphical desktop environment.

tools.name: StudyCentric
tools.one_line_profile: Web-based research DICOM viewer for clinical study management
tools.detailed_description: A research-focused DICOM viewer developed by the Department of Biomedical and Health Informatics at CHOP. It is designed to facilitate the visualization and review of medical imaging data within the context of clinical research studies.

tools.name: eegUtils
tools.one_line_profile: R package for processing and visualizing EEG data
tools.detailed_description: An R package providing a collection of utilities for the processing, analysis, and visualization of electroencephalography (EEG) data. It includes functions for data import, preprocessing, and generating topographical plots.

tools.name: BlueLight
tools.one_line_profile: Lightweight browser-based DICOM viewer
tools.detailed_description: A pure JavaScript DICOM viewer that runs in the browser, supporting various medical imaging modalities. It aims to provide a lightweight, zero-footprint solution for viewing medical images without server-side rendering.

tools.name: PyNets
tools.one_line_profile: Workflow for structural and functional connectome ensemble learning
tools.detailed_description: A reproducible workflow designed for the analysis of structural and functional connectomes. It utilizes ensemble learning techniques to integrate multi-modal neuroimaging data for graph theoretical analysis and network modeling.

tools.name: WebGL Brain Viewer
tools.one_line_profile: Web-based viewer for brain surfaces and tractography
tools.detailed_description: A WebGL-based application for visualizing 3D brain surface models and diffusion tractography data. Developed at Children's Hospital Boston, it enables interactive exploration of neuroanatomical structures in a web browser.

tools.name: nii-masker
tools.one_line_profile: CLI wrapper for Nilearn masking operations
tools.detailed_description: A command-line tool that wraps Nilearn's Masker objects, allowing users to extract time-series signals from NIfTI images using regions of interest (ROIs) or masks without writing Python scripts.

tools.name: Databricks Pixels
tools.one_line_profile: Scalable processing and visualization framework for medical images
tools.detailed_description: A solution accelerator by Databricks for large-scale processing of medical images (DICOM) and documents. It integrates the OHIF Viewer and segmentation models to facilitate interactive learning and data management in a lakehouse architecture.

tools.name: brainview
tools.one_line_profile: Python module for 3D brain morphometry visualization
tools.detailed_description: A Python library based on Matplotlib and Mayavi for visualizing morphometric data on 3D brain meshes. It provides tools to map statistical maps or anatomical data onto cortical surfaces.

tools.name: fsbrain
tools.one_line_profile: R library for surface-based neuroimaging visualization
tools.detailed_description: An R package designed for structural neuroimaging, providing high-level functions to read, write, and visualize surface-based brain morphometry data (e.g., FreeSurfer output) for individuals and groups.

tools.name: TriDFusion
tools.one_line_profile: MATLAB-based medical imaging viewer for 3D fusion
tools.detailed_description: A medical imaging viewer written in MATLAB that supports the visualization and fusion of 3D imaging data. It allows for the overlay of different modalities and basic image manipulation.

tools.name: threeBrain
tools.one_line_profile: R package for interactive 3D brain visualization
tools.detailed_description: An R package that uses Three.js to create interactive 3D visualizations of brain MRI and intracranial electrode data. It is particularly useful for visualizing electrode localization and functional data in a web-compatible format.

tools.name: DIPY
tools.one_line_profile: Comprehensive Python library for diffusion and structural MRI analysis
tools.detailed_description: DIPY (Diffusion Imaging in Python) is a major library for the analysis of diffusion magnetic resonance imaging (dMRI) data. It includes methods for reconstruction, tractography, registration, and statistical analysis, as well as visualization tools.

tools.name: ecog_fmri_visualization_matlab
tools.one_line_profile: MATLAB toolbox for ECoG and fMRI visualization
tools.detailed_description: A set of MATLAB functions designed for the flexible plotting of intracranial EEG (ECoG) electrodes and fMRI statistical maps onto 3D brain models. It supports custom visualization of multimodal neuroimaging data.

tools.name: NIfTI-Studio
tools.one_line_profile: MATLAB toolbox for NIfTI visualization and editing
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB-based toolbox for viewing, editing, and 3D rendering of medical images in NIfTI and Analyze formats. It provides a graphical interface for inspecting volumetric data and performing basic manipulations.

tools.name: MRI Viewer
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance web-based medical image viewer
tools.detailed_description: A web-based tool developed by EPAM for advanced 2D and 3D visualization of medical images (MRI/CT). It supports volume rendering, isosurfaces, and multi-planar reconstruction in the browser.

tools.name: fhlin_toolbox
tools.one_line_profile: MATLAB toolbox for multimodal neuroimaging analysis
tools.detailed_description: A collection of MATLAB routines for processing and visualizing fMRI, EEG, and MEG data. It includes interfaces for working with FreeSurfer data and performing inverse problem calculations.

tools.name: 3DCurator
tools.one_line_profile: 3D viewer for CT scans of cultural heritage objects
tools.detailed_description: A specialized 3D viewer designed for analyzing CT scans of polychromed wood sculptures. It aids in the conservation science domain by allowing detailed inspection of internal structures and layers of heritage artifacts.

tools.name: brainplotlib
tools.one_line_profile: Lightweight Python package for brain surface plotting
tools.detailed_description: A Python package focused on plotting brain surface data. It provides a simple interface for visualizing cortical maps and neuroimaging results on standard brain meshes.

tools.name: dicomViewerLib
tools.one_line_profile: Angular component for DICOM visualization
tools.detailed_description: A reusable Angular library for displaying DICOM images in web applications. It provides components for basic medical image viewing and manipulation within the Angular framework.

tools.name: DSI Studio
tools.one_line_profile: Tractography and diffusion MRI analysis software
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive software tool for diffusion MRI analysis, fiber tracking, and connectome mapping. It supports various diffusion reconstruction methods (DTI, GQI, QSDR) and provides interactive visualization of white matter tracts.

tools.name: FreeBrowse
tools.one_line_profile: Browser-based neuroimaging viewer based on FreeView
tools.detailed_description: A web-based implementation of the FreeView visualization tool, built on top of NiiVue. It allows users to visualize FreeSurfer outputs and other neuroimaging data directly in a web browser.

tools.name: FreeSurfer
tools.one_line_profile: Suite for processing and analyzing human brain MRI images
tools.detailed_description: A premier software suite for the analysis and visualization of structural and functional neuroimaging data. It provides an extensive set of tools for cortical surface reconstruction, subcortical segmentation, and longitudinal analysis.

tools.name: dicomgraphics
tools.one_line_profile: Go-based DICOM viewer and graphics utility
tools.detailed_description: An open-source application and library written in Go for viewing and manipulating DICOM graphics. It leverages the Fyne toolkit to provide a cross-platform interface for medical image inspection.

tools.name: pycortex
tools.one_line_profile: Python toolkit for fMRI surface visualization
tools.detailed_description: A Python library designed for visualizing fMRI data on cortical surfaces. It creates interactive WebGL-based 3D viewers that allow for the exploration of functional maps projected onto brain geometry.

tools.name: Ginkgo CADx
tools.one_line_profile: Advanced open-source DICOM viewer
tools.detailed_description: A cross-platform DICOM viewer that provides advanced features for medical image visualization, including MPR (Multi-Planar Reconstruction), DICOMization of other formats, and PACS integration.

tools.name: colormap_to_ITKSNAP
tools.one_line_profile: Utility to convert Matplotlib colormaps to ITK-SNAP format
tools.detailed_description: A Python script that facilitates the transfer of colormaps from Matplotlib to the ITK-SNAP segmentation software, enhancing the visualization customization options for neuroimaging data.

tools.name: HTML5 Dicom Viewer
tools.one_line_profile: Web-based DICOM viewer using HTML5
tools.detailed_description: A Java-backed HTML5 application for viewing DICOM images in a web browser. It provides basic functionality for displaying medical images without requiring client-side installation.

tools.name: embedded-pydicom-react-viewer
tools.one_line_profile: Browser-based DICOM viewer using Pyodide and React
tools.detailed_description: A web-based DICOM viewer that runs Python code in the browser via Pyodide/WebAssembly. It utilizes pydicom for parsing and React for the UI, demonstrating a serverless approach to medical image analysis.

tools.name: Niivue
tools.one_line_profile: WebGL2-based NIfTI volume viewer
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight, zero-footprint WebGL2 component for visualizing NIfTI and other neuroimaging volume formats in the browser. It is designed to be embedded in web applications for fast and interactive 3D rendering.

tools.name: MedicalViewer
tools.one_line_profile: Qt-based 2D/3D DICOM viewer
tools.detailed_description: A desktop application for 2D and 3D visualization of DICOM images, built using Qt, ITK, and VTK. It supports multi-view display and basic image processing functions.

tools.name: NgDicomViewer
tools.one_line_profile: Angular application for DICOM viewing
tools.detailed_description: A web application built with Angular for viewing DICOM images. It provides a user interface for browsing and inspecting medical imaging data in a web environment.

tools.name: zViewer
tools.one_line_profile: DICOM viewer based on DCMTK and OpenGL
tools.detailed_description: A desktop DICOM viewer application developed using DCMTK for DICOM handling and OpenGL for rendering. It includes PACS functionality and features for reading and displaying medical films.

tools.name: DWV
tools.one_line_profile: Zero-footprint DICOM Web Viewer library
tools.detailed_description: An open-source JavaScript library for viewing DICOM images in web browsers without plugins. It supports various DICOM modalities and provides tools for windowing, zooming, and drawing annotations.

tools.name: pydiq
tools.one_line_profile: Simple open-source DICOM browser and viewer
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight DICOM viewer written in Python using PyQt, allowing users to browse and view DICOM files easily.

tools.name: medview
tools.one_line_profile: Web-based medical DICOM image viewer
tools.detailed_description: A medical image viewer built with HTML5 and JavaScript, supporting DICOM format visualization directly in the browser.

tools.name: rustymind
tools.one_line_profile: Driver and real-time plotter for NeuroSky MindWave EEG headset
tools.detailed_description: A Rust-based driver, parser, and real-time brainwave plotter for the NeuroSky MindWave EEG headset, enabling data acquisition and visualization.

tools.name: DicomViewer
tools.one_line_profile: DICOM image viewer for iPad
tools.detailed_description: A native iOS application for viewing DICOM medical images on iPad devices.

tools.name: dicomweb-proxy
tools.one_line_profile: Proxy service for DICOMweb to DIMSE translation
tools.detailed_description: A proxy server that translates between modern DICOMweb (RESTful) and traditional DICOM DIMSE services, facilitating PACS communication and integration.

tools.name: EEGEdu
tools.one_line_profile: Interactive browser-based EEG visualization and education platform
tools.detailed_description: A web-based platform for interactive EEG tutorials and real-time visualization using WebBluetooth and Muse devices, designed for education and experimentation.

tools.name: VoxelViz
tools.one_line_profile: Interactive fMRI data visualization tool
tools.detailed_description: A visualization tool for fMRI datasets built using Plotly Dash, allowing for interactive exploration of voxel-wise data.

tools.name: dicom-ecg-plot
tools.one_line_profile: DICOM ECG Viewer and Converter
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool to view and convert DICOM ECG files into various formats like PDF, PNG, JPG, and SVG.

tools.name: WizardHat
tools.one_line_profile: Real-time BCI data processing and plotting tool
tools.detailed_description: A tool for real-time processing and plotting of data streamed over Lab Streaming Layer (LSL), specifically designed for student-led Brain-Computer Interface (BCI) projects.

tools.name: QMRITools
tools.one_line_profile: Quantitative MRI processing and visualization toolbox
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive toolbox for processing and visualizing quantitative MRI data, including diffusion, perfusion, and structural MRI analysis.

tools.name: webDICOM
tools.one_line_profile: Web-based DICOM viewer
tools.detailed_description: A web application for viewing DICOM medical images directly in the browser.

tools.name: dicom.el
tools.one_line_profile: DICOM viewer for Emacs
tools.detailed_description: A DICOM viewer extension for the Emacs text editor, allowing users to view medical images within the Emacs environment.

tools.name: BrainNet Viewer
tools.one_line_profile: Graph-theoretical network visualization tool for brain connectivity
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB-based graph-theoretical network visualization tool that helps researchers visualize structural and functional connectivity patterns from different levels.

tools.name: MNE-Python
tools.one_line_profile: Comprehensive library for MEG and EEG data analysis
tools.detailed_description: An open-source Python package for exploring, visualizing, and analyzing human neurophysiological data: Magnetoencephalography (MEG), Electroencephalography (EEG), and intracranial EEG (iEEG).

tools.name: Surf Ice
tools.one_line_profile: GLSL-based surface rendering tool for neuroimaging
tools.detailed_description: A fast, GLSL-based surface renderer for visualizing brain surfaces and tractography, supporting various mesh formats (GIfTI, FreeSurfer, OBJ, etc.) and NIfTI volumes.

tools.name: ipyniivue
tools.one_line_profile: Jupyter Widget for NiiVue medical image viewer
tools.detailed_description: A WebGL-powered Jupyter Widget that integrates the NiiVue medical image viewer into Jupyter notebooks, enabling interactive neuroimaging visualization within Python environments.

tools.name: NiiVue
tools.one_line_profile: WebGL2-based medical image viewer
tools.detailed_description: A high-performance, WebGL2-based medical image viewer component that supports over 30 formats of volumes and meshes, designed for integration into web applications.

tools.name: NiiVue VSCode
tools.one_line_profile: VS Code extension for NiiVue to visualize medical images directly in the editor
tools.detailed_description: A Visual Studio Code extension that integrates NiiVue, allowing researchers and developers to visualize NIfTI and other medical image formats directly within their development environment.

tools.name: Nilearn
tools.one_line_profile: Machine learning and visualization library for NeuroImaging
tools.detailed_description: A Python module for fast and easy statistical learning on NeuroImaging data. It leverages the scikit-learn Python toolbox for multivariate statistics with applications such as predictive modeling, classification, decoding, or connectivity analysis.

tools.name: NiReports
tools.one_line_profile: Reporting and visualization system for neuroimaging preprocessing pipelines
tools.detailed_description: A library for generating visual reports for neuroimaging processing pipelines, providing quality control visualizations and reportlets for tools like fMRIPrep.

tools.name: PySurfer
tools.one_line_profile: Python library for visualizing cortical surface neuroimaging data
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for visualizing cortical surface representations of neuroimaging data. It extends Mayavi to provide a high-level interface for working with FreeSurfer data.

tools.name: Weasis
tools.one_line_profile: Web-based DICOM viewer for medical imaging
tools.detailed_description: A multipurpose web-based DICOM viewer with a highly modular architecture. It allows integration with PACS and supports various medical imaging formats for clinical and research visualization.

tools.name: NiChord
tools.one_line_profile: Python package for creating chord diagrams of brain functional connectivity
tools.detailed_description: A tool designed to visualize functional connectivity data from neuroimaging studies using chord diagrams, helping to represent brain network interactions.

tools.name: FSLeyes
tools.one_line_profile: The FSL image viewer for neuroimaging data
tools.detailed_description: FSLeyes is a powerful and versatile image viewer for displaying NIfTI images, surface meshes, and other neuroimaging data formats. It is the standard viewer for the FSL software library.

tools.name: MMVT
tools.one_line_profile: Multi-Modality Visualization Tool for neuroimaging data
tools.detailed_description: A tool for researchers to visualize and explore neuroimaging anatomical and spatio-temporal data, supporting multiple modalities including fMRI, MEG, and EEG.

tools.name: Aeskulap
tools.one_line_profile: Medical image viewer and DICOM network client
tools.detailed_description: An open-source medical image viewer capable of loading a series of special images stored in DICOM format for review. It also supports querying and fetching data from PACS.

tools.name: OsiriX
tools.one_line_profile: Advanced open-source DICOM viewer for medical imaging
tools.detailed_description: An image processing software dedicated to DICOM images produced by medical equipment (MRI, CT, PET, PET-CT, etc.). It offers advanced 2D and 3D visualization techniques.

tools.name: ITK-SNAP
tools.one_line_profile: Interactive software for medical image segmentation
tools.detailed_description: A software application used to segment structures in 3D medical images. It provides semi-automatic segmentation using active contour methods, as well as manual delineation and image navigation.

tools.name: mrivis
tools.one_line_profile: Medical image visualization library and toolkit
tools.detailed_description: A Python library and toolkit for visualizing medical images, designed to simplify the creation of complex visualizations for neuroimaging data.

tools.name: neuropredict
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for predictive analysis of neuroimaging features
tools.detailed_description: A software tool for easy and comprehensive assessment of predictive power of various features, with specific support for neuroimaging data analysis.

tools.name: Papaya
tools.one_line_profile: Pure JavaScript medical research image viewer
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight, pure JavaScript medical image viewer that runs in the browser. It supports NIfTI and DICOM formats and is widely used for embedding neuroimaging visualization in web applications.

tools.name: hcp-utils
tools.one_line_profile: Utilities for working with Human Connectome Project data
tools.detailed_description: A set of utilities to facilitate the use of HCP (Human Connectome Project) and HCP-like data with nilearn and other Python tools, simplifying data loading and visualization.

tools.name: MRIcroGL
tools.one_line_profile: Hardware-accelerated volume rendering for medical images
tools.detailed_description: A cross-platform tool for viewing NIfTI, DICOM, and other medical image formats using GLSL volume rendering. It allows for high-performance visualization of neuroimaging data.

tools.name: MRIcroWeb
tools.one_line_profile: WebGL-based NIfTI volume rendering viewer
tools.detailed_description: A web-based version of MRIcroGL that uses WebGL to provide volume rendering of NIfTI images directly in the browser.

tools.name: dcm2niix
tools.one_line_profile: DICOM to NIfTI converter
tools.detailed_description: A robust tool for converting medical images from DICOM format to NIfTI format. It is a critical component in many neuroimaging processing pipelines.

tools.name: eeg_positions
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to compute and plot standard EEG electrode positions
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for computing and plotting standard EEG electrode positions (e.g., 10-20 system), useful for sensor layout visualization and analysis.

tools.name: dmri-explorer
tools.one_line_profile: Real-time diffusion MRI viewer
tools.detailed_description: A real-time visualization tool for diffusion MRI (dMRI) data, developed by the SCILUS lab. It supports visualization of tractography and other dMRI derived data.

tools.name: Cerebro Viewer
tools.one_line_profile: Pythonic 3D viewer for brain and neuroimaging data
tools.detailed_description: A Python-based 3D viewer designed to visualize brain models and neuroimaging data. It provides a programmatic interface for creating high-quality brain visualizations.

tools.name: Starviewer
tools.one_line_profile: Cross-platform open source medical imaging software
tools.detailed_description: A cross-platform medical imaging workstation and viewer. It supports DICOM and other formats, offering tools for 2D and 3D visualization and image analysis.

tools.name: imtool3D_td
tools.one_line_profile: 3D Image Viewer with ROI tools for MATLAB
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB-based 3D image viewer that includes tools for manual segmentation and Region of Interest (ROI) analysis, supporting NIfTI and other formats.

tools.name: dicom-viewer
tools.one_line_profile: 3D medical dataset viewer
tools.detailed_description: A C# application for viewing medical datasets in 3D, supporting DICOM files and providing volume rendering capabilities.

tools.name: VR-DICOM-viewer
tools.one_line_profile: VR viewer for interacting with DICOM data
tools.detailed_description: A Virtual Reality application designed for viewing and interacting with DICOM data, such as CT scans, in an immersive 3D environment.

tools.name: arrayShow
tools.one_line_profile: MATLAB viewer for multidimensional complex data including MRI images
tools.detailed_description: A Matlab-based image viewer designed for browsing and visualizing multidimensional complex data, specifically tailored for MRI reconstruction and analysis workflows.

tools.name: UnfoldMakie.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Visualization tools for EEG data and regression ERP models in Julia
tools.detailed_description: A Julia package providing plotting and visualization capabilities for EEG data, specifically designed to work with Unfold.jl for regression-based Event-Related Potential (ERP) analysis. It leverages Makie.jl for high-performance graphics.

tools.name: neuroskymindwavecapture
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to capture and plot raw EEG data from NeuroSky Mindwave headsets
tools.detailed_description: A Python utility for interfacing with NeuroSky Mindwave headsets to capture, record, and plot raw EEG data, facilitating low-cost BCI research and data acquisition.

tools.name: u-dicom-viewer
tools.one_line_profile: Cross-platform web-based DICOM viewer
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight, web-based DICOM viewer that allows users to view medical imaging data directly in a browser on various devices, supporting standard DICOM formats.

tools.name: Dicom-Viewer
tools.one_line_profile: Python application for displaying 2D and 3D DICOM images
tools.detailed_description: A desktop application built with Python for loading, viewing, and interacting with 2D and 3D DICOM medical images, suitable for basic medical image inspection.

tools.name: netplotbrain
tools.one_line_profile: 3D visualization package for brain networks and connectivity
tools.detailed_description: A Python package designed to create publication-quality 3D visualizations of brain networks (nodes and edges) projected onto brain surface atlases.
